dialogues.text: Your safety is entrusted to me by the mightiest power on Olympos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But without a thought, you risk life and limb, your own and your fellows'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monster killed my friend. I could not contain my rage. But you, Goddess, are aloof from the emotions of Men. Vidalia's eyes narrow, enraged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, a tyrannical Goddess, who dares question your mad rush to annihilation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hopes of multitudes reside with you. You're late in learning you cannot act upon every impulse. She whirls and walks away. Perseus is left with the weight of his culpability... and the beginning of knowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CADRE of REVOLUTIONARIES led by Fantasos is gathered. Agenor, the handsome scullion who made love to Andromeda, leads Peshet in from the rain. She is frightened; Agenor has misled her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you brought me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay... Peshet tries to leave, but Agenor stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just listen to this good man. He needs your help. Fantasos comes forward. He fixes her with a hypnotic gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know who I am, child?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are the Priest of the Streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. You know that the good common people of Joppa trust that I will look after their welfare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you love the people of Joppa, Peshet? (as she nods,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want them to be destroyed by this awful curse? (as she shakes her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, of course not. You want what's best for the people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have always served the royal family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you have, good Peshet. And now you may be in a better position than anyone to help the Princessa save the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amoun smokes his pipe by the dying campfire. Perseus approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Amoun... You knew about me, didn't you? When you came to our village?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your birth was written in the stars. I sought you out and took it as my cause to teach you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You chose a poor student. I have learned little and my mistakes cost dearly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understanding that is the first                          step toward knowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't do Boreas any good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can honor Boreas by the way you act from this moment forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no demigod, Tutor. I'm not even much of a human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is not your choice. You are what you are. Amor fati, Perseus. 'Love thy fate.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not believe my fate is to be half a God. No demigod could feel as confused as I do tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concentrate on the task before you. All answers will come with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me of the Cleon Desert Legion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fierce group. Trained to fight... Amoun's DESCRIPTION CONTINUES as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The desert camp of the Legion is lit by torches. The LEGION SOLDIERS are handsome, powerful career warriors, going about their evening business -- eating, cleaning weapons, washing.

dialogues.speaker: AMOUN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: . behind enemy lines. A LOOKOUT peers into the dark desert, listening. Now he HEARS something, turns and shouts to another SENTRY:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Night Patrol returns on the Gorge Road! That message is shouted along from Sentries to Guards in the camp. OUT IN THE DARKNESS on the dusty Gorge Road, a dozen Soldiers gallop in GROUND-SHAKING FORMATION toward the firelit encampment.

dialogues.speaker: AMOUN
dialogues.text: . They've been chasing Djinn Raiders in the mountains for years.

dialogues.speaker: PERSEUS
dialogues.text: Djinn Raiders?

dialogues.speaker: AMOUN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Yes, Godly zealots, supposedly insane. They fight like Hades himself is keeping score... From the dark SURROUNDING DESERT, WE SEE the Night Patrol ride into camp and dismount.

dialogues.speaker: AMOUN
dialogues.text: .. That's how the Desert Legion came to be called 'God-slayers.' I'm not ashamed to say I'll be relieved to have their protection the rest of the way... Amoun's Voice FADES. TILT DOWN TO the barren, desert flats. Suddenly, a miracle transforms the moonlit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strange, beautiful MAGENTA FLOWERS sprout magically where there had been only dirt and cacti. The LOTUS BLOSSOMS surround the camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cleon camp is just twinkling lights from here on the mountain. Startlingly, a huge DEFORMED PAW/CLAW/HOOF scrapes onto a boulder. Pulling himself INTO VIEW in repulsive CLOSEUP -- Kalibos. (There, within his frightening visage, is the distinctive crooked scar we noticed on the jaw of Acrisius in his human form.) When his twisted body has gained purchase, he looks up the mountain. AN EERIE LIGHT illuminates his awestruck countenance. Above him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Tiamat, ensconced in a natural throne of rock. Turning a Lotus blossom in her hand, she smiles on Kalibos, like a benevolent mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My loyal friend. it is beneath you to stalk this band of infidels one by one. Events demand more decisive action. Kalibos' SPEECH is as tortured and deformed as his body -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grorashnrd... I to be... ruler... rhodirs... made whole... sovfrenty... kingdom mine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Kalibos, the time is nigh when I restore you to your rightful form -- proud Acrisius. With me, your protector, on the throne of Olympos... the violator Zeus deposed. Kalibos reacts, with what must be satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go down into this valley. See what I am building for you -- an army dangerous and fearless as you, their leader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several Soldiers have been drawn from camp by the IRRESISTIBLE FRAGRANCE of the Lotus flowers. They pluck petals and chew them. The rest of the Legion filters out between the tents to take their fill of the drug. Kalibos watches the handsome, powerful warriors from across the field of Lotus blossoms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peshet comes into the dark room and looks at the lump on Andromeda's bed. On instinct, she hurries to the bed and throws off the covers -- a pile of cushions, no Andromeda. Peshet races out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peshet sprints through the RAIN, dodging the REFUGEES and CITIZENS like a cat, peering under each hood, searching for her mistress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the plaza, a rabid throng of Refugees. Fantasos, the Revolutionary leader, exhorts the mob, surrounded by BODYGUARDS, including Agenor. As before, Fantasos seems to have actual hypnotic powers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much are we meant to suffer? Where is your mighty King? Safely cloistered above the flood... on the high ground, with the high- born -- the privileged gentry!... The angry crowd responds, fists shaking. Peshet moves through the throng, desperately looking for Andromeda. She passes close to the rostrum and Fantasos registers her presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . Does Kepheus worry about you? No! Only the Princessa... And still, the Kraken comes! Does the King build his defenses at the water's edge? "NO!" cries the crowd. Peshet is shocked to find herself replying with them -- "NO1" Fantasos motions for Agenor to continue the harangue, while Fantasos hurries off the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! He makes his stand at his daughter's chamber door!... We will show Kepheus we're not sacrificial fodder. We will tremble the walls of his Basilica! RABID SUPPORT from the mob. Peshet stops suddenly, peering ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at the fringe of the crowd, Andromeda herself watches from the anonymity of a hooded cloak, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: AGENOR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Andromeda is the one Tiamat wants! We die so she may live... As the crowd EXPLODES, Andromeda hurries away in tears. Peshet fights through the crush to follow her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peshet rounds a corner, frustrated. Andromeda is gone. A hand grabs Peshet's shoulder, startling her. It is Fantasos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peshet, you've come at the right time. Fantasos engages her with hypnotic power. Peshet nods, trance-like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One night soon, a gong will sound three times. When you hear it, unlock the back gate of the Basilica. Then go to Andromeda's chambers... (hands her a dagger) . and bring the Princess out. My men will take her to Leviathan. Peshet just stares at the dagger, hands trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you understand me? (harshly, off her non-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peshet, do you understand how important your part is? She nods, horrified by her predicament.

dialogues.speaker: TERRITORIES... 19 DAYS REMAINING
dialogues.text: The Expedition moves through a mountain pass. Perseus eyes a cliff. Amoun and Draco stop. Glimpses of CLOAKED FIGURES in the boulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to know about Djinn Raiders. Here they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the others) Look sharp. Watch your surround.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidalia warily eyes the carpet of magenta flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alkali Lotus... She stops, spotting something in the distance. Kosmo pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shimmering through the desert heat -- tents and flags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An army bivouac... flying the flag of Joppa. Its the Cleon Legion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Expedition enters the abandoned camp. They look around in dismay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is everyone? Spyros HEARS something and follows the SOUND to a tent, weapon ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spyros looks inside. A cauldron BUBBLES over a fresh fire. ALKALI LOTUS blossoms bob on the boiling broth. Spyros, uneasy, backs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spyros comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Draco, tell me what this -- Everyone is standing perfectly still. DARK FIGURES surround them. The transformed Cleon Legion lurches INTO VIEW. The only resemblance to the soldiers they were is their armor.. Now they're monstrous creatures: LOTOPHAGI.

dialogues.speaker: A DEFORMED FOOT
dialogues.text: as it plants in the dust. The companion foot lands beside it -- completely different. TILT UP TO: Kalibos. Perseus stands by Vidalia, watching the monsters. Kalibos immediately focuses on the demigod. He sniffs the air around Perseus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lotophagi. Lotus-eaters. We should leave... now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't do anything rash. I've learned my lesson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time you must do something rash. We all must. Kalibos leans close to Perseus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tosharicana... demigod... expulsotat... Zeusl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Perseus. PERSEUS WHIPS OUT HIS SWORD. The whole Expedition comes to life as THE LOTOPHAGI ATTACK, swift and brutal. Long arms thrash and rip at the Praetorians. Mongke and Tamburlane BLAST the swarm with HANDGONNES. Spyros lobotomizes one with his harpoon. Amoun opens a leather sack of sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muster to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thad, Krikor and Perseus are the first there. Amoun tosses an arc of the black sand around them all. The ring of sand transforms into a dense, swirling swarm of insects. Amoun shouts to the others, still fighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! You can pass through! Draco bolts for the barrier. A Lotophagi spears Kosmo, killing him. Draco slides inside the swarm. He looks back at Kosmo in horror. Polluc slashes zombies and runs toward the swarm. He's almost there when one of the Lotophagi lands on him, sinking fangs into his skull. Polluc sticks his sword into the creature; they both fall over dead. Icos and Spyros fight their way to the swarm and jump inside. Mongke and Tamburlane kill a Lotus-eater and leap over the corpse into the protected circle. The tide of HOWLING and SHRIEKING Lotophagi claw at the barrier of insects to no avail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only humans can penetrate the shield! Perseus takes quick stock of the group inside the swarm, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only humans... He looks over the Lotophagi and sees Vidalia out there, alone, flinging sling-bullets as she fights her way toward the barrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the barrier!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! It's too late for her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it, Amoun! At that moment, Kalibos grabs Vidalia and drags her to the top of an outcrop. At the top, he turns, LOOKS DIRECTLY AT PERSEUS and HOWLS, his message clear: "If you want to save her, come and get her." He hungrily rips her leather bandeau. Perseus turns to Amoun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the barrier down or I'll go through it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you learned nothing? If you break out now, we're all at risk. On the boulder, Kalibos grabs Vidalia's white flesh. Perseus is anguished; he knows he's in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've learned one thing for certain! Perseus shouts at Thad, the massive Praetorian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down! Perseus backs away three steps. To the others

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get ready to defend yourselves! Perseus runs, plants a foot on Thad's back and leaps out through the swarm, which immediately dissipates around the humans. They have only a moment to react as the stunned Lotophagi come to their senses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's kill these freks! Perseus runs over the backs of the Lotophagi. Hurtling off them, he scrambles up and knocks Kalibos off Vidalia. Ralibos rolls, flips onto his feet and gives Perseus a look: "You're the one that I want." They face off, looking for an opening. Perseus lunges, thrusting his sword. Kalibos dodges, springing up the rocks and then down toward Perseus, acrobatic as an ape. Perseus rolls out of the way. Perseus sweeps his sword at Kalibos' head. The monster catches the blade in his jaws and SNAPS IT IN TWO! Bloody spittle flies from his tongue. Kalibos pounces, pins Perseus. He opens his jaw and sinks his teeth into Perseus' shoulder. Vidalia cracks a rock into Kalibos' head. The creature whirls on Vidalia and careens toward her, head bloody. Perseus leaps in the air and catches Kalibos in the back with both feet, knocking him over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kalibos slams down on the jagged boulders and ricochets off, pinwheeling through the air. The grotesque figure hits the lower rocks head-first and his neck CRUNCHES. He slams into the dust, dead. Perseus lands on his back, weak from the bite. When he tries to rise, his legs are rubbery. Vidalia catches him as he falls forward and lowers him gently, looking at the bloody puncture wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... sshh... I've got you. A THUNDEROUS SOUND SURGES in the distance. Vidalia scans the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Draco, Spyros, Amoun and the others hack away, fending off the Lotophagi. Outnumbered, they won't last long. The earth VIBRATES. The Lotophagi are distracted, looking around nervously. Over a rise stampede SCORPIOCHS, rhino-sized scorpions. Riding them, DJINN RAIDERS, flowing black silk masking all but their blue eyes. They lay into the Lotophagi. The Scorpiochs skewer the beasts with HUGE PINCERS. The Djinn use flashing SCIMITARS to cut them down.

dialogues.speaker: ATOP THE ROCKS
dialogues.text: in Vidalia's arms, the fading Perseus watches as the Djinn turn and surround the Expedition members, closing in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidalia... we need to help them... He blacks out. Vidalia cranes to look over the edge of the cliff where Kalibos fell. She is mystified by what

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deformed monster Kalibos is gone. In his place, neck broken, lies a handsome, aging noble, finally at peace -- King Acrisius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STRING OF LIGHTS, each a lantern hanging from a Scorpioch's tail. The Expedition members ride on the Scorpioch with the Djinn. Some of the huge scorpions carry small box/rooms (palanquins) on their backs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perseus lies sprawled on cushions, unconscious. Vidalia replaces the dressing on his bite wound. Knowing he cannot hear her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To save me, you risked everything -- your mission, your friends... the fate of multitudes. Men need better judgment in the one who is meant to lead them... No longer able to lecture, she regards him with love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have risked your life for me. It is a waste to save me when I'll be gone so soon. She strokes his hair and kisses his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your reckless disregard. Thank you, Perseus... Vidalia holds her palm above the floor and mutters a quick incantation. A small shoot APPEARS and SPROUTS FAT PODS. Vidalia squeezes the salve from a pod and covers Perseus' wound. The wound bulges, then squirms deeper into Perseus. Perseus shoots up, clutching his chest. Vidalia gently lays him down. Perseus gags. A VIPER WRIGGLES from his throat and slithers away with the fat lump of infection in its stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The poison is gone now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where... Where are we? The

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Djinn caravan. They're escorting us to the Skolothian border.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I thought the Djinn... VIDALIA . We all did. But their leader, Shaikh Suleiman, has some special interest in you. (off his confusion) Just sleep. She waves her palm over his face, and he does sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surviving Lotophagi chew on the bones of the fallen. One reaches hungrily for an Alkali Lotus in the sand, but suddenly the petals blacken and curl. The creature, spooked, sniffs the air. All at once, the Lotophagi age years in seconds and keel over, dead. The cause: Set the Void glides over, surveying the battlefield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Expedition rides through a war-ravaged village of stucco and thatch. DOORS and SHUTTERS CREAK shut as they pass, UNSEEN INHABITANTS skitter about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Skolothians have suffered more than their share in this war. The Legions of the Gods have battered them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no wonder they shy away from all strangers. Perseus looks ahead, where the Expedition is parting company with the Djinn Raiders. only one of the Djinn is staying -- SHAIKH SULEIMAN, a veiled priest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does this Djinn priest stay with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of you. You're the reason they saved us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you ask him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought they didn't speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have no mouths. That doesn't mean they do not speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Expedition climbs through rugged country. At a turn, Amoun looks up. Dead ahead, wreathed in fog -- sheer granite pinnacles, one towering above the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pillar of Moirai. Lair of the Norn Sisters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're witches in the form of Strix. Not a pleasant sight, a Strix. They have powerful magic and dreadful habits. Baby-eaters, among other things. (off Perseus' shock) But they owe me a favor. When the war broke out, they lent their power to men against the Gods in exchange for infant sacrifice. Tiamat struck them blind for their treachery. When they came for help, I fashioned them an artificial eye, for their Second Sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made only one eye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased with his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. They have to take turns. If they all could see at once, they would be invincible, which one cannot risk in beings so grotesque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Expedition sleeps in a drizzle.               WHISPERS. Shaikh Suleiman moves toward Perseus. The WHISPERING comes from behind his veil. He pulls a GLEAMING BRONZE SICKLE from his cloak. The priest, blade poised, stands over the sleeping Perseus. OUT OF THE DARKNESS runs Spyros, his harpoon raised for a strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from my boy! Without touching him, the Shaikh throws the fisherman over his head, where he lands hard with an "UMPH!" Perseus jolts awake. He reaches for his sword, but has none. Spyros struggles to his feet to start another charge. Suleiman raises his hand and freezes Spyros in his position. The Shaikh's veil has fallen, revealing his frightening countenance: scaled skin of charred wood; eyes like slots in a furnace. Perseus listens to the WHISPERING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spyros, he means me no harm. The Shaikh lowers his hand: Spyros falls into the dirt. The Shaikh pulls his veil over his face. He kneels before Perseus, head bowed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you and I understand you. But I don't know how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moi ne epos ae'prositi, mene daeva.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are praying to me? There must be a mistake. The Shaikh proffers the gleaming bronze sickle which has a zig-zag, LIGHTNING BOLT PATTERN engraved on the blade, honoring Zeus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An offering'? I thank you and take it humbly, as agift from a friend, not an offering. He takes the weapon and bows his head, surprising the Shaikh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuj patir esti ho theos kosmosr.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You honor my father? You honor Spyros?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho Zeus Patir... Zeus... Perseus reacts, taken aback to hear it from this mysterious stranger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Expedition ascends the sheer pinnacle via rain-slick stairs and GROANING ROPE BRIDGES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a morning fog, the Expedition enters a circle of FREE- STANDING MONOLITHS white with bird crap. All around: regurgitated food, shredded garments and tiny human baby bones. A FLAP of WINGS and suddenly perched atop the stones are the NORN SISTERS: URD, VERDANDI, and SKULD -- human- sized owls with the gray faces of old crones Each has one central EYE SOCKET; they share one ARTIFICIAL ORB. The Strix toss the Eye between them and pop it in to study the arrivals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low, hoot-owl) Amoun... So sorry to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Likewise, Urd. I seek your counsel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want us to tell you about Leviathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know already... of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know this -- the Kraken cannot be defeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've wasted a journey. I trust it was not a taxing one. The Sisters CACKLE HORRIBLY. Skuld SWOOSHES down. Icos and Krikor, terrified, hit the deck. Skuld tosses the Eye back to Urd. Perseus watches with growing irritation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surely the beast from the sea has some weakness. You owe me this answer at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sisters owe nothing to you or any Man! She tosses the Eye to Verdandi, who focuses her attention on Perseus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something wrong with that one. I don't like having him here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me take a look. Verdandi tosses the Eye to Skuld. Perseus leaps and snags the Eye out of mid-air. The Strix SCREECH. Perseus goes to the precipice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell us what we want to know or your Eye has seen its last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Norns flap their wings and puff up their feathers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've brought a thief into our nest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A villain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scum!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, good Sisters... the son of Zeus. The Strix react in horror and all land on the same monolith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since you cannot see, let me tell you what's about to happen. I'm about to throw this evil Eye to the rocks far below. I fear its journey will be a taxing one. The members of the Expedition are impressed; Vidalia, too: the young demigod shows growing leadership. The Strix are panicked --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't tell you. We don't dare betray Tiamat again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees all! Her touch is felt in every evil thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second offense and she will

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to tell us the secret. But you will have to live as blind as she made you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Give us the Eye and we'll tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me first. If I like the answer, you get your Eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need the Eye to see the answer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the answer sure as you already knew the question. The Norn Sisters confer, enclosed in a curtain of wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leviathan can be destroyed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast has one weakness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell us now! The Strix are torn, frightened. Finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stare of Medusa. No creature can look directly in her eyes and still survive. The answer hangs in the silence of the stunned Expedition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're lying, Perseus. Perseus studies the Sisters, weighing his response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe them. (tosses the Eye high) Here's your second sight. Verdandi launches and catches it in her beak, pops it in her socket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Norns) And Medusa! Where does she abide?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Tartaros, beyond the frozen Tethys Sea. Only Charon's ferry dare challenge the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can she be slain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With extraordinary cunning and unimaginable luck. Skuld flaps to the pitch-black portal to an UNDERGROUND VAULT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the proper tools. Explore our cache of spoils. You may find such a tool. Perseus stares into the black entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go in there, Perseus. It's a trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We have guaranteed the rage of Tiamat with this revelation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . we ask only that the young God mention our aid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... to his Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If ever I should meet him. (turns toward the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a light. The Shaikh holds a branch near his eyes until the end bursts into flame and hands it to Perseus, who disappears into the blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perseus fights through cobwebs and hanging roots. The torch REVEALS piles of armor, bones, and broken weapons. A round edge catches his eye. He pulls it free -- A SHIELD, TARNISHED AND DENTED. Unsure why it attracted him, he shoulders it and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STORM RAGES around a FLEET OF SHIPS, manned by armored CREWMEN, that rises and falls on hundred-foot mountains of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FIRST MATE shouts to the stalwart CAPTAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, the storm is too great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joppa is under siege! King Kepheus needs these supplies! Something huge breaches the surface. The captain squints through the rain... and sees the GIGANTIC SCUTED TAIL of Leviathan. IT GOES RIGHT PAST THEM, miraculously leaving the fleet untouched. But then -- they HEAR a sound BIGGER than the typhoon. The dark sky gets darker as an ENORMOUS BLACK SHAPE appears behind the Fleet, bearing down on them at impossible speed -- TIAMAT'S PALACE-GALLEON so dwarfs the Fleet that it PLOWS THROUGH the other ships without noticing, obliterating them in seconds, sending all hands to the depths.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGHTENING VISAGE
dialogues.text: Lit by FLASHES OF LIGHTNING. The Goddess smiles in satisfaction at the devastation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bleak shore. A boulder jetty juts into the cold pewter sea and fades into the fog. Chunks of ice bob on the lapping waves.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: The Expedition, miserably wet, waits for passage around a campfire on the frigid beach. Perseus, polishing the shield he got from the Norns, looks to Amoun, who sits smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell of the Gorgoneion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rape of Medusa? Everyone falls silent. The soldiers shift, suddenly nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With respect, Magi, do not recite that black tale. You'll bring the sky down upon us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does a fairy tale frighten you, soldier? Thad looks at him, sharply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell the story, sir. My men fear only one thing -- to let fear in their hearts. Mongke says something that means, "Go ahead already."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medusa was a tender young woman once -- a mortal creature of such rare beauty as to tempt even the Gods. One night, on the road home, she caught the eye of the God of Deserts and Entropy -- Set the Void.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: A stunning beauty, YOUNG MEDUSA, carries a water pitcher. Suddenly, frightened, she turns, sees something, drops the pitcher and runs.

dialogues.speaker: AMOUN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: She hastened to hallowed ground, thinking the Goddess Tiamat would protect her in her temple. But the God Set followed. A SHADOW passes swiftly over the shattered pitcher, in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of the dark hall, SET overtakes Medusa, forcing her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His cloak ripples as SHAPES PUSH THROUGH THE SPECTRAL FOLDS -- the girl's reaching fingers, her screaming face.

dialogues.speaker: AMOUN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: He ravished her on the cold floor. She felt the heartless passion of a God.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: Alone, Medusa crawls with bloody fingernails toward the altar.

dialogues.speaker: AMOUN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Despoiled and broken in the shadow of Tiamat's altar, she prayed for comfort and pleaded for courage... But the Goddess of the Deep regarded Medusa with disdain. The prayers of such a frail and filthy mortal angered Tiamat. A bust of Tiamat chiseled from black crystal opens her BLAZING eyes, THROWING A LONG SHADOW OF MEDUSA onto the wall.

dialogues.speaker: AMOUN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The Goddess twisted young Medusa into a loathsome new thing... The contorting shadow shows the transformation. Legs twist and snap and become a slithering tail. Snake heads wriggle from her skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Expedition all hang on Amoun's every word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .. and cursed her with a hateful stare that petrifies to stone all that look upon her.            Grave silence. Draco realizes he's burned his dinner on the fire. Spyros shakes his head. Perseus just stares, a believer.                      NOISES come from the fog: SPLINTERING ICE; SLOSHING OARS. A SHAPE emerges -- an ice-cutting THREE-TIERED GALLEY, oars moving with precision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charon's ferry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prow of the galley cuts through ice. Rows of oars slice the frigid water, pulling the boat through at a steady clip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, hot and loud: PIPES, STEAM, GEARS and PISTONS. CHARON, a grizzled old sea captain, shovels coal and slams the furnace closed. He walks past his "crew" MECHANICAL OARSMEN of tarnished brass, rowing tirelessly. Charon dons furs, then climbs up to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- an icy, slick deck, snow. The Expedition huddle around stoves, miserable. We HEAR the OARS BEAT, the HULL GROAN, the ICE CRACKING. Charon CHORTLES, his VOICE deeper than the sea --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better stoke those fires, boys, it's going to get cold soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a small space among the stores, Vidalia circles Perseus, whose eyes are shut. Suddenly, she sweeps his legs out. He lands hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got a tail and she'll use it just like that. Perseus opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your eyes shut! Open them with Medusa and it will be your last look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're enjoying this too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't see her smile. Or that she regards him with something hotter than amusement. She tries to punch him, but he blocks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good! Pleased, he doesn't sense her right cross, which knocks him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think the Gorgon will hit once and then surrender her head? He gets up, eyes closed, and resumes the defensive position, turning as she moves around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen... you will hear her muscles coil. Feel her hunger in your gut. Ask, how will she feed it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish it, but I can't perceive the world that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can. You're the son of a God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing I have done has convinced me of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do not see yourself clearly yet. In time, your actions in crisis will sharpen your view. Her faith touches him deeply. She resumes the lesson:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do those things, Perseus, and much more. He shadows her movements more closely, back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think a room is silent until someone points out the wind. Then the wind is all we hear. She strikes. He dodges and locks her neck. Pleased, she flips him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprisingly, he lands on his feet, and immediately sweeps her legs. She starts to fall backwards, but -- SLOW MOTION as Perseus dives forward and cradles her gently as they both fall to the floor. A move beyond human. She looks up at his closed eyes, worried. Their lips are inches apart. REGULAR SPEED --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm beginning to hear the wind. (senses something,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidalia... why are you afraid? She kisses him, deeply. He returns it. Suddenly, she rolls free and stands up, turning away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait... She is already climbing the ladder. She stops for only a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've learned enough for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spyros is at the rail, looking over the ocean of ice. Perseus, troubled, arrives. Spyros looks at him closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look I know well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then where? Spyros smiles, puts his huge, calloused hand on Perseus' shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my own mirror, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When does it go away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're lucky... never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A landscape of volcanic rock. Lava pouring into the sea raises VEILS OF STEAM, through which the Expedition disembarks from the galley. SUPERIMPOSE: COAST OF TARTAROS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Expedition crosses the black terrain, lava vents here or there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, dark ruins -- an ominous tilted facade, half-sunk in the dried lava flow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jaggous temploi Tartaros de Gorgoneion maitress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Temple of Tartaros... Medusa's lair. Mongke and Tamburlane exchange words and point. They all

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO STONE STATUES flank the entrance: a pair of enormous CENTAURS -- NESSUS and IXION, their eyelids sewn shut. Icos and Krikor exchange distressed looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medusa must have turned them to stone. Perseus swings his sickle, measuring its balance, and adjusts his shield. He checks a canvas sack on his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going into the Temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I go with my boy. Perseus, Spyros, and Draco split off toward the temple. Suddenly, the two "statues," Nessus and Ixion, shake off their dusty skins and COME TO LIFE. They GALLOP down the ridge, hooves shaking the ground. They raise fearsome spiky maces of jagged iron. Vidalia readies her sling. The Shaikh draws his scimitar. Mongke and Tamburlane load their handgonnes, the others draw swords.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Temple group arrives at the steps. Draco speaks to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you afraid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay close and I'll steer us through. They tie on blindfolds and feel their way into the Temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nessus and Ixion arrive. Ixion's mace catches Krikor, flinging him to his death in an open lava vent. Icos CRIES OUT for his friend and charges in. Ixion smashes him to oblivion. Thad, enraged, races at Nessus, but the Centaur dodges the massive Praetorian and kicks him in the chest, killing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nessus charges Amoun. Amoun throws a handful of sand, which becomes a hail of STEEL-BARBED DARTS in midair, which lash the Centaur's flesh. Tamburlane rolls under the beast and fires his weapon. Nessus hurls the monster-hunter against a boulder and goes for him when -- -- Shaikh Suleiman jumps between them. His scimitar slashes but is ripped from his hands. The Shaikh BOWS HIS HEAD. Nessus' mace shatters Shaikh Suleiman's head of charred wood. BLUE FIRE shoots out his neck, ENVELOPING THE CENTAUR. The burning Centaur crumples, dead. Ixion SLAMS his mace down, just missing Amoun. Suddenly, Vidalia's sling-bullets slice his flesh. Ixion turns and leaps at Vidalia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the subterranean temple, we HEAR Ixion landing above; dust rains into the cavern. SUNLIGHT angles through holes in the roof. Draco, Spyros and Perseus move blindly through the debris. CORPSES everywhere, faces frozen in stone screams. The men can't see it, but one wall suddenly frames a silhouette of MEDUSA: HAIR OF HISSING SNAKES atop a woman's torso, the body of a mammoth reptile. WE SEE only GLIMPSES of Medusa as she slides through the shadows. Her forked tongue tastes the air. CUTTING BETWEEN Spyros, Perseus and Draco, moving silently on opposite sides of the sanctuary. OUR VIEW of Draco is suddenly BLOCKED by Medusa -- she coils around Draco without touching him. He HEARS the RASP of SCALES ON STONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear her, Perseus. She's near! Her torso behind him, she RATTLES her tail in front. Draco spins and slices the air. The RATTLE stops. Draco waits, confused.

dialogues.speaker: PERSEUS
dialogues.text: (from across the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Draco, be wary -- Medusa gingerly tugs Draco's blindfold free. Draco sees the tail before him. Unthinking, he instinctively spins and looks. Medusa's face is inches from Draco's. His muscles lock and his flesh hardens to scabrous stone, emanating SMOKY GAS. Medusa breathes in the vapors ecstatically. AT THAT MOMENT a hole blasts through the roof of the cavern as Ixion crashes down in a cloud of dirt -- dead, a gaping wound in his head. Medusa regards her fallen minion in horror, loosing a MOURNFUL SIGH. Spyros HEARS HER and blindly hurls his harpoon toward the sound. WITH THE HARPOON as its sails cleanly through slanted pillars and debris, WHOOSH, WHOOSH, until it comes through a tiny opening and -- THUDS into Medusa's body! The Monster SCREAMS, whipping about. She tries to pull the harpoon out, but can't.

dialogues.speaker: SPYROS
dialogues.text: Perseus, I think she's hit!

dialogues.speaker: PERSEUS
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: SPYROS
dialogues.text: Near to the left! Medusa's enraged attention shifts back and forth between the VOICES of the two men, deciding which to attack. Perseus tries to control his shakes, jumping at every sound, head swiveling blindly. From a distance --

dialogues.speaker: SPYROS
dialogues.text: Perseus... I don't hear her near me! Perseus steps back and BUMPS into a column.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE HIM
dialogues.text: Medusa is coiled around the column, harpoon stuck in her bloody side. She CRAWLS DOWN toward Perseus. Perseus against the column. FROM THE TOP OF FRAME, Medusa's fingers reach for his blindfold. She pulls the knot and the blindfold falls. Eyes closed, Perseus slashes the air, sweeping the sickle about until it SMASHES into the column -- BRINNNGI The SOUND ECHOES, then FADES. Perseus waits and listens. Then, PING!, one drop of Medusa's blood lands on his shield. Perseus opens his eyes and peers into his shield. In the reflection on the bronze, he SEES: Movement. Snakes. Searing eyes... Medusa! Eyes shut, he windmills his weapon above him. Medusa's talons DEFLECT the blade and the sickle flies from his grip. Perseus scrambles for it on his hands and knees. Behind him, Medusa SLITHERS down the column and heads for Perseus. Perseus reaches the sickle. He lifts his shield up in front of him and sees Medusa's reflection growing closer behind him. He shuts his eyes and wheels around, blade sweeping. A soft F-THMMP as the blade slices through something... SILENCE. Perseus turns away and opens his eyes, looking into the shield. Still, Medusa looms behind him! But suddenly, Medusa's head THUDS and rolls on the ground. The headless reflection topples over, dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE AFTERMATH: the survivors -- Vidalia, Amoun, Mongke, and Tamburlane -- take mournful stock of their losses. Mongke sees something, smiles and SWEARS in his language. They all turn to see: Perseus and Spyros, spent and saddened, stand at the top of the Temple steps. Perseus grasps the canvas sack. Now it holds Medusa's head, which bloodies the whole bag and sends a crimson drip to the stones. There is still movement in there -- squirming serpents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain and waves pound the Lower Wharf, the water choked with debris and rotting corpses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kepheus stands in the rain with his MINISTER OF DEFENSE and GENERALS at his side. A massive tent town has been pitched in the piazza. VOICES -- frequent and angry -- SHOUT CURSES at the Basilica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The relief fleet is lost. Monsters gather outside our walls. Soon I won't be able to keep my own people at bay. And still, no word from the Expedition. Kepheus raises a spyglass to survey the view beyond the city walls.

dialogues.speaker: TIAMAT'S ARMY
dialogues.text: on the plain outside the city. BONFIRES RAGE, monster regiments assemble. Siege towers roll toward the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiamat commands a massive horde. How many days remain?

dialogues.speaker: MINISTER OF DEFENSE
dialogues.text: Four, Majesty... Kepheus lowers the glass, looking grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our forces prepare. We have cards yet to play. We'll buy the time we need until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until the Expedition perhaps returns?... Until we're saved by the fisherman's son?

dialogues.speaker: MINISTER OF DEFENSE
dialogues.text: My king, remember and take hope... he is not truly the son of a fisherman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From your lips, I pray, to his true father's ear. Andromeda has appeared. All are shocked to see her. She addresses the others with an authority we've never seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would speak with the King in private.

dialogues.speaker: MINISTER OF DEFENSE
dialogues.text: Princess, let us find a protected

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can speak here, in the elements our subjects endure. The King's men exchange looks, then bow discreetly away, leaving father and daughter alone. Andromeda looks down at the tent city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They take refuge from the Lower Wharf. A sight I wish you'd never seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've sheltered me too long from the hard things in this world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have it no other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I thank you for the gift of my cosseted youth. But now, with Mother so... (turns to him) It's time I shared this burden you've carried so long. Filled with emotion, he puts an arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make me proud, but you are only a child... my little one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no longer. Your protection of me has brought hardship to our people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and to me, perhaps, new understanding. I must ask you something, Father. She turns away from his gaze and looks down at the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you could end this siege with just one unselfish act, would you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To save my people, yes, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such an act is within my power. He studies her a moment, then becomes alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop itl I forbid you to entertain such thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perseus and the others were willing to give everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns her to him) Listen to me. By the time this is over, your mother and I may well be gone. But I guarantee the day is coming when Joppa will know glory under Queen Andromeda. She embraces him, head upon his shoulder, where he can't see her resolve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be at peace, Father, I will not cause you any more sadness than I already have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ancient walled road curves over the pastoral orchard hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The exhausted Expedition is now six: Perseus, Vidalia, Amoun, Spyros, Mongke, and Tamburlane. They've stopped at a well beside a MILESTONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spyros studies the ancient words carved into the milestone: "Polis of JOVE PATER : XI stadia S."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleven stadia to the South... What is 'Polis of Jove Pater'? I'm ignorant of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jove the Father is another name by which Zeus was known. This milestone dates from when city states were named for their patron deities. Perseus, filling his canteen, peers at the marker as Amoun uses one hand to cover the letters "-VE" and the other the letters "-TER."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'The Polis of Jove Pater' is the ancient name of --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Joppa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Joppa... once the most sacred site in the worship of Jove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dawning on him) Tiamat chooses the city of Zeus to take hostage. (as Amoun confirms

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She compels the people to make human sacrifice of the Princess Andromeda...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . and transforms Joppa into the new church of Tiamat. The ancient abode of Zeus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: becomes the new home of Tiamat, granting her sway to supplant him as the God of Gods. (urgently to Perseus) You can't allow Tiamat to rule Olympos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perseus holds her look. "No," he won't let that happen. But in his eyes are fear and doubt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Expedition passes through deep woods. Spyros and Perseus ride side by side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, we've seen much on this journey we cannot hold in our hands. Yet these things are real enough. At each turn, we find monsters and Gods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, the evidence is everywhere once we leave our island. That's why I so rarely leave. These Gods, what do you make of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you always said, they're petty, vengeful... and dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, as bad as men. (as Perseus smiles) And would you have that sort guide your life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Men must be accountable to themselves. Otherwise we serve poor masters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my boy. Amoun rides up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should stop for the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must keep moving. Time is running out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we don't rest the horses, they won't make it to Joppa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all need rest. If you don't save yourself, you'll have nothing left when you face the Kraken. Riding behind them, Vidalia (paler and more ephemeral than ever) is suddenly alert. She peers into the woods, agitated. Then she EXCLAIMS SOFTLY, dismounts and runs into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidalia! Perseus slides from his horse and follows her. Mongke says something to Tamburlane; they LAUGH. Amoun to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we stop here tonight? Spyros smiles, looking off after Perseus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidalia darts through the trees. She stops, closes her eyes, moves off again.                                  THROUGH A STAND OF TREES, Vidalia appears again, and stops, searching her senses. Perseus arrives and watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this place... Suddenly, she hurries to the trunk of an ancient tree. She probes the foliage, steps forward... and descends into the ground, out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Following, Perseus pulls away greenery, revealing an opening in the tree's massive roots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perseus drops into a dim, earthen den. Vidalia stands motionless before a bare altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my church. Where I was born to the world. Where my people prayed to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who were they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know they were humans. They seemed so fragile. I sheltered them because I thought the harsh world would break them. Now I know I underestimated them. Her eyes pierce Perseus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I saw you come out with Medusa's head, I saw that a Man had done an impossible thing. Beautiful, yes, but not fragile. Resilient. Fearless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was mad with fear. I was no hero. I just didn't want to die. Perseus turns toward the altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? A marble tablet sits on the altar, its surface defaced. Vidalia runs her fingers along the scoring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the war began, Men ranged through the hills, stamping out any trace of God-worship they found. (touching the tablet) My true name was carved here. When it was obliterated, my worshippers lost faith and my last season began.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will vanish, quick as dew evaporating at dawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one will notice the moment because all thought of me will be gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing can save me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her in his arms. Vidalia is riven by anguish and desire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe that. Will love not buy another day, Vidalia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was cut free of earthly longing. Why did you have to give me a name? The light is almost gone now. They kiss. The wilted blossoms in her crown slowly open with color. They begin to make love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perseus and Vidalia lie together, listening to the SOUNDS of nightingale, cricket and owl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you vanish, I'll find you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather look at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what I tell you. (as he does) I'm going to give you a spell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give away your secrets. You still have need of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me give you this sliver of magic. I'll write it on your instinct. When the time comes, you'll know how to use it. She takes his head in her hands, pressing her forehead to his. Gently, her fingers slip into his mind. A TEAR runs down her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In QUICK FLASHES: A white lid opens to a black eye. Reflected in the eye -- clouds roll over a stormy sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feathered WHITE WINGS beat the air. Then: Racing over the surface of a blue SEA, and then down, down, to SMASH THROUGH the surface, into the depths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiamat and Set the Void stand over the corpse of Medusa. Baby snakes and beetles spill out of her neatly-sliced neck. Tiamat is furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did he do this? They were not even to reach Medusa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fate has begun to shift. The future ripples with uncertainty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spare me your pitiful maundering! There is no Fate beyond my actions and no uncertainty in the face of my will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant only that the demigod bends the path without knowing it. He is ignorant of the rules, or unconcerned with them. She turns on him with such a violent look, he flinches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then there shall be no rules! Prove to me you have not lost that which makes you most valuable. Set absorbs her tirade, stung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Zeus... the others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am your ally. That is all you need to know. Bloody your hands and rid me of this pestilence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have liberated me, my Queen. Watch as your desires are quickly satisfied. Set disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perseus jolts awake. He reaches for Vidalia, but she is gone. Amoun stands over him, his manner severe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my fault. I've permitted .this infatuation to progress too far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is not yours to permit, Master... with respect. Vidalia comes down into the shrine, her apron full of berries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what I've found for us -- She startles when she sees Amoun, dropping the berries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you forgotten Perseus is engaged to the Princessa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't marry Andromeda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Amoun and Vidalia are surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If by some miracle you survive this encounter with Leviathan, the hand of the Princessa is your reward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want no reward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you so selfish? Would you risk everything for the foolish love of -- A BLAST of HOT DESERT WIND blows into the Shrine. The berries turn brown and shrivel. Amoun grabs his chest. Perseus and Vidalia crumple in agony. SET THE VOID COMES INTO THE SHRINE. Amoun tries to invoke a spell, but Set touches his chest and Amoun splits open. Set points at Vidalia, slamming her into the earthen wall. The God is there in an instant, strangling her. Perseus staggers up and swings his sickle, but Set points, ripping the weapon from Perseus' hand. It flies across the shrine and sinks with a CLANG into the tablet that once held Vidalia's true name. Still choking Vidalia, Set grabs Perseus' arm. Perseus doubles over, paralyzed by the God's touch. Suffocating, Vidalia FADES MORE. Immobilized, Perseus watches her struggle and searches

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low, rasping) I am half God... and now is the time... Perseus rises. He cocks his arm and clobbers Set with an ear-splitting CRACK OF THUNDER and a sparking BURST OF WHITE ENERGY. Set drops Vidalia and lurches back, aghast. BLACK BLOOD shoots from his mouth. Perseus, his face contorted in rage, chokes Set. The God's body SPASMS and deforms in DEATH THROES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perseus slams the God down in a ghastly heap, which liquefies into thick black blood. It seeps into the sandy floor, leaving an ugly stain. Perseus rushes to embrace Vidalia, who is more evanescent than ever. They look with pain at the remains of Amoun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry, Perseus. A look of brutal, determined resolve grows in Perseus' face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You faced a God in lethal combat... and vanquished him. Never have I heard of such a thing. He looks at her, mind racing, then lifts her as he stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must go quickly now. He pulls the sickle from the marble with a BRINNG! The light flashes off Zeus' LIGHTNING BOLT PATTERN on the blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The combat has just begun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantasos and the LEADERS of the Revolution are gathered around a SACRIFICIAL FIRE. They fill the room with their CHANTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We invoke thee, Queen of the Deep. We attend thee only to listen and obey. Fantasos moves through smoke to an altar, on which is a fearsome IDOL OF TIAMAT, unlike any representation we've seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We serve your will so that we may be absorbed into your perfection... Holy of holies... Tiamat! The Sanctuary is suddenly filled with the VOICE of --

dialogues.speaker: TIAMAT
dialogues.text: Loyal servants... it may be an illusion, but the Idol seems to have taken on the most subtle of life. It does not move, but it breathes.

dialogues.speaker: TIAMAT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You have sown the seeds of revolt. Now comes the harvest. My legions stand ready at the gates. Only one rite of consecration remains before the Ascension. Fantasos, closest to the Idol, flinches, buffeted by an unseen draft.

dialogues.speaker: TIAMAT
dialogues.text: The hour of sacrifice is upon us. Offer up the Princess Andromeda to Leviathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GONG sounds ONCE in the night. Repheus sleeps fitfully on a divan by the bed of the desiccated Cassiopeia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GONG sounds again. CLOSE ON Andromeda's tortured face staring down at the city -- too CLOSE to see exactly where she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GONG sounds a THIRD TIME. Peshet opens a lock and sets the heavy gate ajar. She looks at the dagger in her palm and hurries inside. After a moment, four CLOAKED REBELS slip through the open gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peshet enters, dagger held at her back. No sign of Andromeda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lady? Princess Andromeda? She goes deeper into the rooms, then GASPS, looking off,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andromeda stands on the balustrade of her balcony, preparing to jump to her death. She turns at the sound, teetering. Peshet rushes to her but stops when Andromeda raises a knife of her own. Peshet is shocked, not afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peshet, stop! I know what I am meant to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lady, please --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was afraid, Peshet. Afraid to understand that the fate of so many could rest with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Princessa, give me your hand. Andromeda, please. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at the drop) I'm not afraid anymore. I will do what I must. I will die so that they may live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, but Peshet leaps and grabs her, pulling her to safety. They fall to the floor, both daggers CLATTERING on the marble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't allow it, my lady. Today, you are only a Princess. One day your people may need a Queen ready to die for them. Peshet snatches up the dagger from where she dropped it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, we have to hide you... right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops, picks up Andromeda's knife and hands it to her. Andromeda accepts it with resolve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peshet leads Andromeda out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must get to my mother and father. A VOICE from the darkness:

dialogues.speaker: AGENOR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Your father is dead and your mother has been relieved of her suffering. The four Cloaked Rebels step into the light. Agenor wipes his bloody dagger on his cloak as all four advance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princessa is coming with us. She has a rendezvous to keep. Peshet WHIPS HER DAGGER through the air; it THUDS into the neck of the First Rebel, killing him on his feet. Before he can fall, Peshet leaps to him and pulls out her knife. She plants herself in front of Andromeda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come and get her. Agenor and the other two circle Peshet. She moves with feline agility, but is separated from the Princess. To the Second Rebel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the Princess -- alive! The Second Rebel circles around Peshet toward Andromeda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run, Princess! Save yourself. Peshet leaps on the Third Rebel. Andromeda runs away from the Second Rebel, who easily closes the gap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going anywhere, Your Highness. He grabs her in a bear hug from behind. She spins, tiny within his massive arms, and is suddenly facing him. He JOLTS in surprise, Andromeda's knife in his belly. He falls on her, dead. Peshet wins her struggle with the Third Rebel, sinking her dagger in him. She GASPS. Agenor has thrust his blade into her ribs. She totters and COUGHS -- deep and bloody. Peshet falls against the wall. Andromeda WAILS at the sight. She is pinned beneath the dead weight of the Second Rebel, unable to move. Agenor finishes off Peshet and turns to the Princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The survivors -- Perseus, Vidalia, Spyros, Mongke, and Tamburlane -- crest a hill in the RAINY DAWN LIGHT. Vidalia is almost transparent. The Expedition reacts in shock to what they see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're on a shelf above the wide, flat basin that lies outside Joppa. A limitless INHUMAN ARMY -- Centaurs, Minotaurs, Monsters of every stripe -- fills the plain, right up to the city walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Among the regiments of Joppans waiting nervously for the battle are ranks of fifteen-foot AUTOMATA (CLOCKWORK SOLDIERS). OPERATORS feverishly work the mechanisms of the steel soldiers, which flex their artificial limbs and weigh their massive weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mongke and Tamburlane exchange words. For the first time, they look impressed -- but also delighted. This is what they live for. Spyros looks over at his adopted son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it should come to pass, tell your mother and sister I loved them much. Perseus reaches out and touches his foster father warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to tell them yourself. Vidalia's voice has become weaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people are frightened. But they can triumph.. They need only one thing. Perseus turns to her, a question on his face -- "Tell me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hero. They're waiting for you, Perseus. Perseus looks back toward the city. At last, there is no uncertainty in Perseus --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not fail them. He turns toward the Goddess, but Vidalia is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidalia? (realizing,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's too late. She's disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PELTING RAIN. HUNDREDS OF ONLOOKERS have gathered. An IRON WINCH sits on a GRANITE PLATFORM on the cliff's edge. Fantasos and his cohorts wait beside a huge BRONZE GONG. Agenor brings Andromeda barefoot through the mud. The onlookers jostle for a better view, some spiteful, some sad, all curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agenor removes Andromeda's cloak, revealing her tattered nightgown. Fantasos inspects the MYSTERIOUS SYMBOLS inked on her naked back, streaked by rain. Agenor's thugs chain her to the winch at the precipice, hundreds of feet above the raging sea. As the winch is cranked, the chain lifts Andromeda upside down from the ground. Agenor pulls Andromeda close and flashes a cruel grin. She spits in his eye. He wipes his eyes and lets go of the chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she RISES: The cliff drops straight down the jagged wall to the churning waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O Leviathan, firstborn of the Deep, accept this offering of mortal flesh... for the exaltation of your Cosmic Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFF THE COAST OF JOPPA, a dark shape emerges from the squall -- Tiamat's enormous Palace-Galleon. The Goddess is at the prow, looking toward the cliffs of Joppa expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the huge GONG IS STRUCK --

dialogues.speaker: THE FACES OF THE ONLOOKERS
dialogues.text: Then... GONG! Fantasos continuing his incantations, then... GONG! Andromeda's face, her frightened eyes searching the ocean. Everyone looks out to sea, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perseus, Spyros, Mongke, and Tamburlane hear the far-off GONG, GONG, GONG. The Mongols speak to Perseus in their language, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sacrifice has begun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must get to the cliffs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? They all look at what separates them from the city --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MONSTER ARMY OF TIAMAT surges forward with savage BATTLE CRIES. The GATES OF THE CITY swing open. Out march the giant mechanical AUTOMATA, followed by streaming legions of JOPPAN INFANTRY. The two armies slam together -- The battle is joined. THEY FIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GONG! The wind rocks Andromeda on her CREAKING CHAIN. She watches... A mile offshore, a BULGE OF WATER SWELLS and plows toward the coast. The Onlookers watch in terrified awe as the swell races closer. Leviathan explodes from the surface, too huge to be seen whole. It shoots straight up, up, up the three-hundred- foot cliffs. The Kraken's jaws hurtle up at Andromeda. Onlookers recoil. Fantasos stumbles in panicked retreat. The creature's BELLOW is deafening. At the apex of its surge, it SNAPS ITS JAWS SHUT with a booming THUNDERCRACK... just millimeters from Andromeda's dangling head -- and FALLS BACK. Churning surf surrounds its endless SLIDE back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kraken slips underwater and its vast shadow immediately begins to circle wide for another attempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spyros, Mongke and Tamburlane mount their nervous horses. PUSH IN ON Perseus, who does not mount up. From his saddle, he takes the bloody canvas bag with Medusa's head inside and slaps his horse away. Be MURMURS the INCANTATION Vidalia planted in his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white lid opens to a black eye... Feathered WINGS beat the air... The rippled flanks of a WHITE CREATURE.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Perseus HEARS the BEATING OF THE WINGS and looks toward the forest. PEGASUS WHOOSHES over the treetops, BANKS and LANDS in front of Perseus. It bows, inviting Perseus aboard. Perseus climbs on and rides up to the others, who are flabbergasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May we all have a good ride today! He spurs Pegasus. it beats its wings, launching from the ridge with astounding power.

dialogues.speaker: MONGKE AND TAMBURLANE
dialogues.text: Qi chin yang hung xian!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit. They raise their weapons and spur their horses down the slope to war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK-CLACK-CLICK-CLACK. The chain lowers Andromeda toward the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andromeda manages to get herself swinging back and forth until she builds enough momentum to reach up and grasp the links above her. With effort, she climbs the very chain she dangles from, leaving a slack loop beneath. Leviathan's eyes break the surface below, watching Andromeda. With a HOWL, Leviathan HURTLES UPWARDS, jaws wide.

dialogues.speaker: FROM ABOVE
dialogues.text: Leviathan grows huge as it leaps for her. UP, UP, UP. The JAWS SNAP CLOSED... just below her climbing feet. So close, it BITES ON THE DROOPING SLACK OF CHAIN! The monster slides back down, clutching the chain in its jaws. The Princessa plummets with it.

dialogues.speaker: UP ON THE PLATFORM
dialogues.text: The chain unreels wildly, pulls tight... and rips the platform from its anchors. It careens over the edge, taking Fantasos, Agenor and their Thugs to their screaming death. A SHADOW glides over the shocked onlookers. One by one, they tear their gaze from the sea and look up, GASPING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PERSEUS AND PEGASUS descending. Perseus sees Andromeda splash down and get pulled under. The winch platform SLAMS into the cliff face, pulled by Leviathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly the image he saw when Vidalia first planted the spell in his mind -- down, down toward the dark sea.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Perseus and Pegasus arrive a moment before the crashing winch. Perseus dives off with the bloody Medusa bag in hand. With his free hand, he catches the chain just ahead of the winch and goes under.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leviathan hurtles downward. Andromeda flails, bound to the chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perseus grips both the chain and the bag in his hand. Leviathan spirals on, but THE WINCH CATCHES ON A REEF and the chain SNAPS! Andromeda, suddenly separated from the monster, sinks, weighted by her shackles. Perseus, swimming with the raw power of a porpoise, dives after her, but loses his grip on the bag. Desperate, he looks back and forth: Andromeda, the sack -- both sinking. Perseus goes after the sack. Leviathan realizes it has lost the Princess. Huge eyes darting, it spots Andromeda and surges down after her. Andromeda, drowning, passes out. Tiny bubbles leak from her nose. Leviathan swims down to her, eye as big as her entire body. The wreck of a SUNKEN WHALER rests on the ocean floor. The Medusa sack FALLS INTO VIEW and catches on a harpoon wedged in the deck. Perseus appears, snags the sack and is about to kick upward. On impulse, he grabs the harpoon. Leviathan opens its huge jaws. Andromeda is sucked toward the maw. Perseus swims upward toward Leviathan's tail. Perseus concentrates -- a sparking BURST OF WHITE ENERGY shoots through his forearm to the harpoon in his grip. LIGHTNING CRACKLES and BOILS the water. He plunges the harpoon in the Kraken's tail -- -- at the same moment Leviathan inhales the unconscious Andromeda. Contact -- an ELECTRIC FLASH-POINT FLARES and a charge races up Leviathan's spine. Jolted, the monster spits Andromeda out. The Kraken twists to lock its enraged gaze on Perseus. Perseus shuts his eyes and yanks Medusa's head from the sack. Medusa's hellish eyes ignite channels of boiling energy into Leviathan's enormous eyeballs -- hardening them to boiled eggs, then rocky spheres.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monster thrashes, tries to turn -- but unbending stone races its length, freezing the gargantuan curves -- the scuted tail locks mid-flail into a final, permanent hook. Dead in the water, the grotesque mass sinks like a mountain range, picking up speed as it plunges into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perseus must swim like a God to snatch Andromeda from the downward tug. The stone Kraken barely misses them as it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and CRASHES in a cloud of silt, SHAKING THE OCEAN FLOOR like an earthquake. A CRACK opens in the seabed and sucks back the silt. The trench deepens and streaks away across the seabed, swallowing all the water above it, creating a giant opening to the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiamat's face contorts, sensing her beloved Leviathan is dead. She turns at the sound of GHASTLY CREAKING -- the immense length of the galleon buckles into a hole in the ocean. As the towering masts drop below wave-level, Tiamat raises her arms to the sky --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I damn you, Zeus! You will hear my curses forever in the crash of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walls of water collapse, burying the Goddess, her ship, and her malediction deep in her realm. We HEAR a world- rocking ROAR, which booms off toward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiamat's Monster Army is DEAFENED by the BOOM, losing all spirit with the unmistakable certainty that their Goddess is gone. THE TIDE TURNS IN THE BATTLE as the Joppans and their steel allies, the Automata, wade into the ranks of creatures. Mongke and Tamburlane, in the center of the battle, find the opposition turning tail. They roar and lift their weapons high, surviving yet another fight. Spyros, bloodied but unbowed, smiles wide and sits down in the mud, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water stills. The sea calms. No sign of Perseus or Andromeda. WIND and QUIET... CHOOM! Perseus surfaces with Andromeda in his arms, GASPING FOR AIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The onlookers rejoice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK WITH Perseus and Andromeda. He looks at her lifeless countenance in agony -- has he failed again as he did with Anteros the fisherman?? Distraught, his muscles go taut around Andromeda, and a short powerful burst of electric energy shoots from his arms into her still body -- SHE JOLTS TO LIFE! Movement! Breath!
