Color returns to her face. Perseus, too, breathes again, relieved. For the first time since the start of the adventure, they find themselves alone, holding each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. (as she smiles,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right? She takes a moment, doing an inventory. Finally, she nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I am. He smiles. She'll never know how close they came to oblivion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready to become a king? His expression is kind, but unmistakable. "No." She accepts that, rueful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready to become a queen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks about it, her face beginning to light with confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes, I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you're ready to go home. Perseus raises one arm. The-AIR reverberates to a LOUD BEATING OF WINGS. Andromeda looks up in wonder. Pegasus appears out of the sun's glare, gracefully alighting on the water. Perseus helps Andromeda up and then climbs on behind her. Pegasus takes off. TILT UP WITH them until they are lost from sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black smoke RISES to dirty the perfect sky. TILT DOWN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sacred Ground of Joppa in the verdant hills, above the sea, is so beautiful it might be mistaken for Olympos. TWO FUNERAL PYRES burn. The citizens of Joppa, by the thousands, commend King Kepheus and Queen Cassiopeia to the afterlife. MOVING OVER THE CROWD, WE PUSH THROUGH the flame to find the new ruler of Joppa. Mournful, but cloaked in regal dignity and strength -- QUEEN ANDROMEDA.

dialogues.speaker: THE QUEEN
dialogues.text: The ceremony and the heavenly setting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perseus views the scene from a nearby hill. Behind him, Pegasus waits patiently, grazing the grass. Until --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the equine suddenly WHINNIES and REARS UP. Just as quickly, Pegasus goes silent and BOWS DOWN. Perseus looks in that direction, to find -- ZEUS the Prime, God of Gods, an eagle perched on his arm. He couldn't look more imposing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I to understand you do not intend to make this union with the Queen Andromeda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite my will and intention that you do so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you choose to condemn Men, your own people, to suffer more of this devastating War?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no people. You have stranded me between realms, neither man nor God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you reproach Zeus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I thank you... Father. Zeus, mighty God, reacts to the word. His expression softens and he looks on Perseus with growing pride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have freed me. I will not be a pawn for Men or Gods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that absolve you suddenly of your responsibilities?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've made me understand that my responsibility is to myself. So it is with us all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've put me to a great test. In the midst of it, I found the courage in my heart to defy Gods. I do not know how much of that comes from you, Father... and how much from my Mother, who I never knew. Zeus starts, subtly, at the mention of Queen Danae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It matters not. Whatever the source, I are only grateful. He looks off toward the funeral pyres and the human throng.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This war will end the moment you choose for it to end... and Men agree. I think, perhaps, that is the free will that all realms share. Zeus looks at him, proud, yet wistful -- what an offspring, what a creation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will you do, Man of free will? Perseus motions Pegasus forward, and swings up onto his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to find Vidalia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... my Son, you will be a pawn for love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Father, gladly. Perseus spurs Pegasus and launches into the sky. And soars away. FADE OUT.
